intro: Erysimum leptophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and its flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in spring. It is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
